title: Latin America & the Caribbean : homicide rates 2017 , by country
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
The highest Country El Salvador has 57.5 more Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants than the lowest Country Chile.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants 61.8 is found at Country El Salvador and the minimum is found at Chile where Country is 4.3.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants 61.8 is found at Country El Salvador and the minimum is found at Chile where Country is 4.3.
Country Jamaica has the second highest value for Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants.
The difference of Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants between the highest and lowest Country is 57.5.
The Country El Salvador has the highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants, followed by Jamaica, and Honduras. Down to the Country Chile which is the lowest.
The Country Chile tends to be 2.97 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 457.4.
